page.title: 02Transport Today - Roads
page.content:
The area is well-served with good modern roads, with major improvements having been carried out in the late 70's and early 80's. The M4 motorway which crosses the block from south-east to north was opened in 1978. This helped relieve the traffic bottleneck on the A48 as it passed through{Pontarddulais.
Another major road improvement was the re-alignment of the A4173 south-west from junction 48 of the M4 and by-passing the village of{Llangennech. Traffic is now very heavy on this road as it is the main route to serve the British Steel Corporation plant at Trostre, the NCB mine at Cynheidre, the Open cast mines at Trimsaran and the old and new industries of the town of Llanelli.
